title: Arnold Kling on Economics for the 21st Century
description: Economist, blogger, and author Arnold Kling talks with EconTalk host Russ Roberts about the state of economics in the 21st century. Kling argues that economics would be more useful if it took account of intangibles like culture, incorporated the role of financial intermediation in the economy, and modeled some of the the subtleties of the labor market--how wages are set and the role of team production.
author: webmaster@econlib.org (EconTalk: Russ Roberts)
